Detailed Description

When Bluetooth is instructed to do some operation that goes over the air these operations take at least a couple of time. Such operations are called a request for an operation because the function does not execute the operation. Instead of this the function asks the Bluetooth Stack for the exectution of the operation.
To avoid the running application from blocking while it is waiting for the end of the execution of a requested operation, requests where executed in a asynchronous way. When the Bluetooth Stack has finished a requested operation, it calls a callback function associated with the requested operation. Depending on the profile the relevant Bt...Controller implements this callback function. From within these functions messages were sent to the running application to notify it about the progress and success of the requested operation.
BtRequest is the base class for such requests as described above. To enable the reception of messages BtRequest is derived from UserDispatcher. This class is abstract because it primarily defines the interface to all requests. The execution of a certain operation is implemented by the apropriate Bt...Request class. This is done by calling the corresponding function in one Bt...Controller class that instructs the Bluetooth Stack to execute the requested operation.
Some of the operation requested from the Bluetooth Stack can be interrupted. These request are called cancelable. If a request is cancelable the procedure to cancel an initiated request must be implemented too. The last step of implementing a concrete reqeuest is to implement the On... function to dispatch and handle the messages sent to the application by the apropriate Bt...Controller class.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN BtLocalRequest::EvaluateMessageResult (  const BtRequestMessage &  message  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Check the result parameter of the callback functions.

When a callback function is invoked one parameter is a result code indicatint the state of the ongoing stack operation. Ths result code is interpreted and the if necessary the ChangeRequestState function is called to do the right state change.
This function is a helper function and has to be used be the implementations of a concrete request when it handles the arrived message in the OnMessage function.

Parameters:
message A reference to a BtRequestMessage that references the Bluetooth message received by the OnMessage function.
Returns:
TRUE: The was a state transition.
FALSE: The was no state transition.

Reimplemented in BtRequestRespondRequest.

BtRequestState BtLocalRequest::ExecuteRequest (   )  [virtual]
 

Sumbit this request to the Bluetooth Stack.

ExecuteRequest instructs this request to sent itself to the Bluetooth stack for execution purposes. This function prepares the submission of the request to the stack. The real exection of the stack call is done by the fuction Execute, which is a pure virtual function, that has to be overwritten by the concrete request, which is a subclass of this class.

Returns:
A BtRequestState containing the current state of exectuion for this request. Most times the returned state indicates whether the Bluetooth Stack has accepted or rejected the request.

Implements BtRequest.

void BtLocalRequest::ExecutionCallback (  BtResultCode  result  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Implements BtRequest.

virtual BOOLEAN BtLocalRequest::OnMessage (  const Message &  messsage  )  [protected, pure virtual]
 

Base message handling member function.

The OnMessage member function is the first entry point in every dispatcher for the reception of messages. From there on it will be routed to the appropriate On... member function, if it should be handled by this dispatcher or passed back to the superior dispatcher.

Returns:
TRUE: The received message has be handle. No further handling for the message is needed.
FALSE: The received message is not handled by this dispatcher. Route it forward to the next dispatcher.

Implements Dispatcher.

Implemented in BtDevicePairRequest, BtDeviceSearchRequest, BtDeviceTrustRequest, BtDeviceUnpairRequest, BtDeviceUntrustRequest, BtQuerySupportedProfilesRequest, BtRespondAuthorizationRequest, BtSendPasskeyRequest, BtServiceVerifyRequest, and BtSetRemoteDeviceNameRequest.

virtual void BtLocalRequest::OnRequestStateChange (  BtRequestState  old_request_state,
BtRequestState  new_request_state
)  [protected, pure virtual]
 

Request state change handling member function.

The OnRequestStateChange will allways be invoked when the processing state of this request changes. This function is used to carry out some reactions to the change. It is an pure virtual function and all subsequent (inherited) requests therefore are abstract classes. So the application programmer has to derive the partikular request from the class that fullfills the request and must implement this function. After that the application progammer can use his request to initiate an request at the Bluetooth stack.

Parameters:
old_request_state A BtRequstState containing the state of the request before the change took place.
new_request_state A BtRequstState containing the state of the request after the change took place.

Implemented in BtApplicationSendPasskeyRequest, BtApplicationRespondAuthorizationRequest, BtApplicationDevicePairRequest, BtApplicationDeviceUnpairRequest, BtApplicationDeviceTrustRequest, BtApplicationDeviceUntrustRequest, BtApplicationQuerySupportedProfilesRequest, BtApplicationSetRemoteDeviceNameRequest, BtApplicationDeviceSearchRequest, and BtApplicationServiceVerifyRequest.

BOOLEAN BtLocalRequest::RegisterDispatcher (   )  [protected]
 

Register this request as message dispatcher.

To receive result message the request must register itself at an application to take part at the message routing. The function RegisterDispatcher performs this task. To minimize the number of objects that participate in message routing the request is only registered at an application during its execution process. When it has stopped executing it unregisters itself from the application.

Returns:
TRUE: The request is successfully registered at the application.
FALSE: The registriation of the request at the application failed.

void BtLocalRequest::SetRequestState (  BtRequestState  request_state  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Set processing state of this request.

A request can be seen as it goes through several stages in its execution process. SetRequestState can be used to set the current stage of execution. When the passed in state is other than the current state the OnRequestStateChange callback function will be invoked.

Parameters:
request_state A BtRequestState containing the current stage of exection which has to be set for this request.

Implements BtRequest.

BOOLEAN BtLocalRequest::UnregisterDispatcher (   )  [protected]
 

Unregister this request as message dispatcher.

To receive result messages the request must register itself at an application to take part at message routing. To minimize the number of objects that participate in message routing the request is only registered at an application during its execution process. When it has stopped executing it unregisters itself from the application. This task is done by UnregisterDispatcher.

Returns:
TRUE: The request is successfully unregistered from the application.
FALSE: The unregistriation of the request at the application failed.
